Utterance: hi, ellie
Hi! It’s great to see you again. How have the past few weeks been for you?
They’ve been a bit of a rollercoaster, to be honest.
I’m here to listen. What’s been going on?
Well, I tried the open-ended questions with my son, and it worked a little. He opened up about some school stress, but he still shuts down at times.
That’s a positive step forward! It’s normal for him to have ups and downs. How did you feel when he shared his stress with you?
I felt relieved that he talked to me, but also worried about how much pressure he’s under.
It’s natural to feel that way. Have you discussed ways he can manage that pressure?
We talked about taking breaks and finding time for fun, but I think he still feels overwhelmed.
It might be helpful to explore specific activities he enjoys that could serve as a break. Have you asked him what he likes to do for fun?
Not really. I usually just suggest things I think he’d like.
Asking him directly could empower him to take ownership of his leisure time. What do you think?
That makes sense. I’ll try to ask him what he wants to do.
Good! And how about your schoolwork? Did you reach out to classmates for help?
Yes! I formed a small study group, and it’s been really helpful.
That’s fantastic! What have you enjoyed most about studying with others?
I like the different perspectives they bring. It helps me understand things better.
That’s a great insight. Collaboration can really enhance learning. Have you noticed any changes in your confidence since joining the group?
Definitely! I feel more supported and less isolated.
That’s wonderful! Feeling supported can make a big difference. Have you had any challenges with the group?
Just a little bit of scheduling conflicts, but we’re working it out.
That’s a common issue. Communication about availability can help. How do you feel about handling those conflicts?
I think I can manage it. I just need to be proactive about it.
Exactly! Being proactive is key. Shifting gears a bit, how are your self-care practices going?
I’ve been going to the beach more often, and it’s been great. I even started journaling about my feelings.
That’s fantastic! Journaling can be a powerful tool for self-reflection. How has it felt to write down your thoughts?
It’s been really cathartic. I didn’t realize how much I had bottled up.
That’s an important realization. Have you found any recurring themes in your journaling?
Mostly just worries about the future and my kids. I also write about my dreams and goals.
That’s a healthy balance. Acknowledging worries while also focusing on your aspirations can help you move forward. What’s one dream or goal you’d like to focus on next?
I want to explore more about pursuing a career in counseling. I think it could be a good fit for me.
That’s a wonderful goal! Have you thought about what steps you might take to explore that path?
I’ve considered looking into volunteer opportunities or internships to get some experience.
That’s a great idea! Gaining experience can help you determine if it’s the right fit. Would you feel comfortable researching some local opportunities?
Yes, I think I could do that. I’ll make a list of places to check out.
Perfect! I’m excited to hear what you find. Remember, taking small steps can lead to big changes.
Thanks for the encouragement, Ellie. I really appreciate it.
You’re doing great work! I look forward to hearing about your progress in our next session.
Me too! Bye for now.
Bye! Take care.
